title: Psalms Chapter 92 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Psalms chapter 92 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Psalms Chapter 92 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Psalms Chapter 92.

questions.question: According to Psalms 92:1, what is it good to do on the sabbath day?
options: Give thanks unto the LORD and sing praises
Rest and keep silent
Fast and pray
Gather food and prepare meals
questions.correctAnswer: Give thanks unto the LORD and sing praises
questions.explanation: Psalms 92:1 states it is a good thing to give thanks unto the LORD and to sing praises unto His name on the sabbath day.

questions.question: What does Psalms 92:2 say we should show forth in the morning and at night?
options: Lovingkindness in the morning and faithfulness every night
Joy in the morning and peace every night
Prayer in the morning and fasting every night
Light in the morning and darkness every night
questions.correctAnswer: Lovingkindness in the morning and faithfulness every night
questions.explanation: The verse clearly says to shew forth God's lovingkindness in the morning and His faithfulness every night.

questions.question: Which instruments are mentioned in Psalms 92:3?
options: Instrument of ten strings, psaltery, and harp
Drums, trumpet, and lyre
Flute, cymbals, and harp
Harp, trumpet, and cymbals
questions.correctAnswer: Instrument of ten strings, psaltery, and harp
questions.explanation: Psalms 92:3 mentions playing upon an instrument of ten strings, upon the psaltery, and upon the harp with a solemn sound.

questions.question: According to Psalms 92:4, why does the psalmist say he will triumph?
options: Because the LORD has made him glad through His work
Because he is stronger than his enemies
Because he has wealth and power
Because he follows the law perfectly
questions.correctAnswer: Because the LORD has made him glad through His work
questions.explanation: The psalmist triumphs in the works of God's hands as stated in Psalms 92:4.

questions.question: What does Psalms 92:5 say about the LORD’s works and thoughts?
options: His works are great and His thoughts are very deep
His works are small and His thoughts are shallow
His works are unknown and His thoughts are hidden
His works are fleeting and His thoughts are simple
questions.correctAnswer: His works are great and His thoughts are very deep
questions.explanation: Psalms 92:5 praises the greatness of God's works and the depth of His thoughts.

questions.question: True or False: Psalms 92:6 says a brutish man and a fool understand the LORD’s works.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Psalms 92:6 states that a brutish man knoweth not, neither doth a fool understand.

questions.question: What will happen to the wicked according to Psalms 92:7?
options: They shall be destroyed forever
They shall prosper and multiply
They shall be forgiven and saved
They shall be hidden and protected
questions.correctAnswer: They shall be destroyed forever
questions.explanation: The verse explains that though the wicked flourish like grass, they shall be destroyed forever.

questions.question: According to Psalms 92:8, who is most high forevermore?
options: The LORD
The king
The righteous man
The prophet
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD
questions.explanation: Psalms 92:8 declares that the LORD is most high forevermore.

questions.question: True or False: Psalms 92:9 says the enemies of the LORD will perish and be scattered.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: The verse clearly states that the enemies of the LORD shall perish and all workers of iniquity shall be scattered.

questions.question: What does the psalmist say the LORD will exalt in Psalms 92:10?
options: My horn like the horn of an unicorn
My crown like the crown of a king
My sword like the sword of a warrior
My shield like the shield of a soldier
questions.correctAnswer: My horn like the horn of an unicorn
questions.explanation: The psalmist says the LORD will exalt his horn like the horn of an unicorn in Psalms 92:10.

questions.question: According to Psalms 92:11, what will the psalmist’s eye and ears perceive?
options: His desire on his enemies and the wicked rising up against him
The beauty of the mountains and the songs of birds
The peace of the land and the joy of the people
The coming of the dawn and the setting of the sun
questions.correctAnswer: His desire on his enemies and the wicked rising up against him
questions.explanation: Psalms 92:11 states that the psalmist's eye shall see his desire on his enemies, and his ears shall hear of the wicked rising up against him.

questions.question: Fill in the blank from Psalms 92:12: 'The righteous shall flourish like the ______: he shall grow like a cedar in Lebanon.'
options: palm tree
rose
oak tree
cypress
questions.correctAnswer: palm tree
questions.explanation: Psalms 92:12 compares the flourishing of the righteous to a palm tree.

questions.question: Where are those planted who shall flourish, according to Psalms 92:13?
options: In the house of the LORD
In the desert
In the valley
On the mountain
questions.correctAnswer: In the house of the LORD
questions.explanation: Psalms 92:13 says those planted in the house of the LORD shall flourish in His courts.

questions.question: True or False: Psalms 92:14 says the righteous shall still bring forth fruit in old age.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: The verse affirms that the righteous will be fruitful and flourishing even in old age.

questions.question: According to Psalms 92:15, what does the psalmist say about the LORD?
options: The LORD is upright and my rock with no unrighteousness
The LORD is distant and hard to find
The LORD is silent and hidden
The LORD is angry and vengeful
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD is upright and my rock with no unrighteousness
questions.explanation: Psalms 92:15 declares that the LORD is upright, is the psalmist's rock, and there is no unrighteousness in Him.

medium.title: Psalms Chapter 92 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Psalms Chapter 92 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does Psalms 92 teach us about the importance of daily devotion and gratitude in Christian living?
options: By showing forth God's lovingkindness in the morning and faithfulness every night
By avoiding all work on the sabbath day
By giving offerings only on special occasions
By focusing solely on personal needs
questions.correctAnswer: By showing forth God's lovingkindness in the morning and faithfulness every night
questions.explanation: Psalms 92:1-2 emphasizes giving thanks and singing praises daily, specifically showing God's lovingkindness in the morning and faithfulness every night, highlighting the value of consistent devotion and gratitude.

questions.question: A fellow believer struggles with feeling defeated by the success of wicked people around them. What biblical truth from Psalms 92 would you share to encourage them?
options: The wicked may flourish temporarily but will be destroyed forever
They should try to imitate the wicked to succeed
God approves of the swift rise of the wicked
Ignore the wicked and focus on worldly gain
questions.correctAnswer: The wicked may flourish temporarily but will be destroyed forever
questions.explanation: Psalms 92:7-9 teaches that although wicked people may prosper like grass and flourish for a time, they will ultimately perish and be scattered, encouraging believers to trust God's justice and timing.

questions.question: How does Psalms 92 encourage believers to maintain integrity and trust in God's justice despite trials?
options: By affirming that the LORD is most high forever and will exalt the righteous
By telling believers to avoid all conflict
By promising wealth and fame for the faithful
By instructing believers to seek revenge
questions.correctAnswer: By affirming that the LORD is most high forever and will exalt the righteous
questions.explanation: Psalms 92:8-10 assures believers that God is supreme and will exalt His people, encouraging perseverance and trust in His justice rather than taking matters into their own hands.

questions.question: What practical lesson about spiritual growth and fruitfulness does Psalms 92 provide for Christians as they age?
options: The righteous will still bear fruit and flourish even in old age
Spiritual growth ends after youth
Old age is a time to rest without producing fruit
Fruitfulness depends only on physical strength
questions.correctAnswer: The righteous will still bear fruit and flourish even in old age
questions.explanation: Psalms 92:12-14 compares the righteous to flourishing trees that continue to bear fruit in old age, illustrating ongoing spiritual growth and productivity throughout life.

questions.question: In the context of church life and fellowship, how can Psalms 92:13 inspire believers to be rooted and active?
options: Those planted in the house of the LORD flourish in His courts
Believers should isolate themselves to grow spiritually
Church activity is only for young people
Faithfulness depends on personal effort alone
questions.correctAnswer: Those planted in the house of the LORD flourish in His courts
questions.explanation: Psalms 92:13 emphasizes the importance of being firmly established within God's house (church community) to flourish and grow, highlighting the value of fellowship and participation.

questions.question: A believer is seeking to understand how to respond to enemies and opposition. According to Psalms 92, what attitude should they maintain?
options: Trust that God will exalt them and satisfy their desire over enemies
Hold grudges and seek personal revenge
Ignore prayer and depend on self-strength
Avoid confronting enemies at all costs
questions.correctAnswer: Trust that God will exalt them and satisfy their desire over enemies
questions.explanation: Psalms 92:10-11 encourages believers to trust God to exalt them and grant victory over enemies, promoting faith and reliance on divine justice rather than personal retaliation.

questions.question: How does Psalms 92 highlight the importance of praising God with music and worship in spiritual discipline?
options: By instructing to sing praises and use musical instruments with a solemn sound
By forbidding the use of instruments during worship
By focusing only on silent prayer without songs
By limiting worship to verbal prayer only
questions.correctAnswer: By instructing to sing praises and use musical instruments with a solemn sound
questions.explanation: Psalms 92:1-3 directs believers to give thanks and sing praises using specific instruments, illustrating the value of musical worship as part of spiritual discipline.

questions.question: What does Psalms 92 teach about humility and recognizing human limitations?
options: Brutish men and fools do not understand God's deep works and thoughts
Everyone fully comprehends God's plans
Humility is unnecessary if one is wise
Only scholars can understand God's works
questions.correctAnswer: Brutish men and fools do not understand God's deep works and thoughts
questions.explanation: Psalms 92:5-6 highlights that God's works and thoughts are profound and not understood by the brutish or fools, encouraging humility and trust in God's wisdom.

questions.question: True or False: According to Psalms 92, God's enemies will ultimately prosper and never be scattered.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Psalms 92:9 clearly states that God’s enemies shall perish and all the workers of iniquity will be scattered, affirming that evil will not triumph.

questions.question: True or False: Psalms 92 encourages believers to rejoice and triumph in the works of God's hands.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Psalms 92:4 expresses joy and triumph in God's works, encouraging believers to rejoice and acknowledge the goodness of His creation and actions.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Psalm 92 compares the righteous to the _______ tree and the cedar in Lebanon, illustrating their flourishing.
options: palm
olive
fig
vine
questions.correctAnswer: palm
questions.explanation: Psalms 92:12 uses the imagery of the palm tree and cedar in Lebanon to symbolize the righteous flourishing and growing strong in their faith.

questions.question: How does Psalms 92 help us understand the role of God's righteousness in daily life and character?
options: God is upright, a rock with no unrighteousness
God tolerates sin among His followers
Righteousness is optional for believers
God's character changes with circumstances
questions.correctAnswer: God is upright, a rock with no unrighteousness
questions.explanation: Psalms 92:15 describes the LORD as upright and a rock with no unrighteousness, encouraging believers to build their lives on God's perfect character and integrity.

questions.question: What spiritual encouragement does Psalms 92 offer for believers facing ongoing hardships and opposition?
options: They will be anointed with fresh oil and their horn exalted
They should expect immediate relief without trials
They must handle problems by themselves
They should withdraw from community
questions.correctAnswer: They will be anointed with fresh oil and their horn exalted
questions.explanation: Psalms 92:10 promises exaltation and anointing with fresh oil, symbolizing God's blessing and empowerment during trials, encouraging believers to persevere with faith.

questions.question: How does Psalms 92 suggest believers should view the works of God in their personal and family life?
options: God's works are great and deep, worthy of joy and triumph
God's works are insignificant in daily life
Only public achievements matter
Family life does not reflect God's works
questions.correctAnswer: God's works are great and deep, worthy of joy and triumph
questions.explanation: Psalms 92:4-5 shows that God's works are cause for gladness and triumph, encouraging believers to recognize and rejoice in God's hand in all aspects of life including family.

questions.question: According to Psalms 92, what is the role of praise and thanksgiving in a believer's work ethic and daily discipline?
options: Giving thanks and singing praises helps believers acknowledge God's hand in their work
Work should be done without acknowledgment of God
Praise is only for special religious ceremonies
Thanksgiving is unrelated to daily labor
questions.correctAnswer: Giving thanks and singing praises helps believers acknowledge God's hand in their work
questions.explanation: Psalms 92:1-4 emphasizes giving thanks and singing praises as a response to God's works, encouraging believers to integrate worship and gratitude into their daily labor and discipline.

hard.title: Psalms Chapter 92 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Psalms Chapter 92.

questions.question: What musical instruments are mentioned in Psalms 92:3 for praising God?
options: Ten strings, psaltery, harp
Trumpet, flute, cymbals
Lyre, drum, horn
Violin, lute, cymbal
questions.correctAnswer: Ten strings, psaltery, harp
questions.explanation: Psalms 92:3 mentions praising God upon an instrument of ten strings, upon the psaltery, and upon the harp with a solemn sound.

questions.question: According to Psalms 92:5, how are God's works described?
options: Great and very deep
Simple and clear
Hidden and mysterious
Small but mighty
questions.correctAnswer: Great and very deep
questions.explanation: In Psalms 92:5, it says, 'O LORD, how great are thy works! and thy thoughts are very deep,' emphasizing the magnitude and profundity of God's works.

questions.question: What does Psalms 92:7 say happens to the wicked who flourish like grass?
options: They shall be destroyed forever
They will be blessed
They shall inherit the earth
They will multiply
questions.correctAnswer: They shall be destroyed forever
questions.explanation: The verse states that though the wicked flourish, it is so that they shall be destroyed forever, indicating the temporary nature of their prosperity.

questions.question: Psalms 92:10 uses the metaphor of an 'unicorn' horn. What does this symbolize for the psalmist?
options: Exaltation and strength
Gentleness and peace
Fragility and humility
Wealth and honor
questions.correctAnswer: Exaltation and strength
questions.explanation: The horn of an unicorn symbolizes strength and exaltation, as the psalmist says, 'But my horn shalt thou exalt like the horn of an unicorn,' indicating divine empowerment.

questions.question: In Psalms 92:12, the righteous are compared to which two types of trees?
options: Palm tree and cedar
Oak and olive
Fig and almond
Pine and cypress
questions.correctAnswer: Palm tree and cedar
questions.explanation: Psalms 92:12 states, 'The righteous shall flourish like the palm tree: he shall grow like a cedar in Lebanon,' highlighting strength and flourishing.

questions.question: Which phrase in Psalms 92:15 emphasizes God's righteousness and reliability?
options: He is my rock, and there is no unrighteousness in him
He is merciful and gracious
He is slow to anger
He is a refuge in trouble
questions.correctAnswer: He is my rock, and there is no unrighteousness in him
questions.explanation: The verse concludes with this phrase, emphasizing God's uprightness and dependable nature.

questions.question: What daily practice does Psalms 92:2 encourage believers to show forth?
options: Lovingkindness in the morning and faithfulness every night
Prayer at noon and fasting in the evening
Giving alms daily
Reading the law each morning
questions.correctAnswer: Lovingkindness in the morning and faithfulness every night
questions.explanation: This verse encourages expressing God's lovingkindness and faithfulness at different times of the day as a continual act of worship.

questions.question: According to Psalms 92:6, who does not understand God's great works and thoughts?
options: A brutish man and a fool
The righteous
The elders
The priests
questions.correctAnswer: A brutish man and a fool
questions.explanation: The verse explicitly states that a brutish man knows not, nor does a fool understand the greatness of God's works and thoughts.

questions.question: What is the significance of 'fresh oil' in Psalms 92:10 in biblical symbolism?
options: Anointing, blessing, and empowerment
Punishment and cleansing
Sadness and mourning
Separation and exile
questions.correctAnswer: Anointing, blessing, and empowerment
questions.explanation: In Scripture, anointing with oil commonly symbolizes consecration and empowerment by God, and here it represents the psalmist's divine favor.

questions.question: How does Psalms 92:13 describe those 'planted in the house of the LORD'?
options: They shall flourish in the courts of our God
They will be chased away
They will wither like grass
They will be silent and humble
questions.correctAnswer: They shall flourish in the courts of our God
questions.explanation: This verse uses the imagery of planting and flourishing to show the prosperity and stability of the faithful in God's presence.

questions.question: True or False: Psalms 92 portrays the wicked as flourishing permanently without consequence.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Psalms 92:7 and 92:9 state that though the wicked flourish temporarily, they will ultimately be destroyed and scattered.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Psalms 92:11 says, 'Mine eye also shall see my desire on mine enemies, and mine ears shall hear my desire of the ______ that rise up against me.'
options: wicked
faithful
righteous
strangers
questions.correctAnswer: wicked
questions.explanation: The verse explicitly mentions 'the wicked that rise up against me,' indicating the psalmist's confidence in God's justice.

questions.question: What theme in Psalms 92 is also prominent in the book of Jeremiah, especially regarding the fate of the wicked?
options: The temporary flourishing and ultimate destruction of the wicked
The prosperity of the righteous
The call to worship with music
The creation of the world
questions.correctAnswer: The temporary flourishing and ultimate destruction of the wicked
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 17:7-8 similarly contrasts the flourishing of the righteous with the downfall of the wicked, paralleling Psalms 92:7 and 92:9.

questions.question: What literary device is prominently used in Psalms 92:12-14 where the righteous are compared to trees?
options: Simile
Metaphor
Allegory
Hyperbole
questions.correctAnswer: Simile
questions.explanation: These verses use similes comparing the righteous to a palm tree and cedar to illustrate flourishing and strength.

questions.question: How does the phrase 'he is my rock' in Psalms 92:15 relate to Old Testament imagery elsewhere?
options: It signifies God's steadfastness and protection, similar to Exodus 17:6 and Deuteronomy 32:4
It denotes a literal stone idol
It refers to a mountain of sacrifice
It means God is unmovable and distant
questions.correctAnswer: It signifies God's steadfastness and protection, similar to Exodus 17:6 and Deuteronomy 32:4
questions.explanation: The imagery of God as a rock is a frequent Old Testament motif symbolizing stability and refuge, as seen in these passages.

theological.title: Psalms Chapter 92 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Psalms Chapter 92 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Psalms 92:1, what is described as a good thing on the Sabbath day?
options: To give thanks unto the LORD and sing praises unto His name
To rest and do no work
To offer sacrifices and burnt offerings
To gather in the temple for teaching
questions.correctAnswer: To give thanks unto the LORD and sing praises unto His name
questions.explanation: Psalms 92:1 explicitly states that it is a good thing to give thanks unto the LORD and to sing praises unto His name on the Sabbath day. This aligns with other scriptures such as Psalm 100:4, Hebrews 4:9-10, and Colossians 3:16 which emphasize thanksgiving and praise as central to worship.

questions.question: What does Psalms 92:2 say should be shown forth every morning and night?
options: Lovingkindness in the morning and faithfulness every night
Justice in the morning and mercy every night
Power in the morning and glory every night
Joy in the morning and peace every night
questions.correctAnswer: Lovingkindness in the morning and faithfulness every night
questions.explanation: Psalms 92:2 calls for the demonstration of God's lovingkindness in the morning and His faithfulness every night. This reflects God's unchanging covenant love and steadfastness, consistent with scriptures like Lamentations 3:22-23, Psalm 36:5, and 1 John 1:9.

questions.question: Which instruments are mentioned in Psalms 92:3 as being used for praise?
options: Instrument of ten strings, psaltery, and harp
Trumpet, cymbals, and tambourine
Flute, lyre, and drum
Sackbut, organ, and lute
questions.correctAnswer: Instrument of ten strings, psaltery, and harp
questions.explanation: Psalms 92:3 specifically mentions the instrument of ten strings, the psaltery, and the harp with a solemn sound as instruments for praise. These instruments are also referenced in 1 Chronicles 15:16, 2 Samuel 6:5, and Ezra 3:10 emphasizing their role in worship.

questions.question: In Psalms 92:4, what is the reason given for the psalmist's gladness?
options: Because of the LORD's works
Because of abundant harvest
Because of victory over enemies
Because of personal wealth
questions.correctAnswer: Because of the LORD's works
questions.explanation: Psalms 92:4 says, 'For thou, LORD, hast made me glad through thy work,' indicating that the psalmist's joy stems from God's creative and redemptive acts. This theme is echoed in Psalm 126:3, Isaiah 61:10, and Revelation 15:3 where God's works bring joy and triumph.

questions.question: What does Psalms 92:5 reveal about the nature of God's works and thoughts?
options: God's works are great and His thoughts are very deep
God's works are small but His thoughts are many
God's works are mysterious and His thoughts are hidden
God's works are simple and His thoughts are shallow
questions.correctAnswer: God's works are great and His thoughts are very deep
questions.explanation: Psalms 92:5 declares that God's works are great and His thoughts very deep, highlighting His wisdom and omniscience. This is consistent with Job 5:9, Isaiah 55:8-9, Romans 11:33, and Ephesians 3:20 which affirm God's profound wisdom and understanding.

questions.question: According to Psalms 92:6, who does not understand the greatness of God's works?
options: A brutish man and a fool
The righteous and the wise
The priests and prophets
The kings and rulers
questions.correctAnswer: A brutish man and a fool
questions.explanation: Psalms 92:6 states that a brutish man knows not, and a fool does not understand God's works, indicating spiritual blindness and lack of wisdom. Proverbs 1:7, Jeremiah 4:22, and 1 Corinthians 2:14 similarly describe the foolish as unable to comprehend divine truth.

questions.question: What does Psalms 92:7 say will happen to the wicked who flourish like grass?
options: They shall be destroyed forever
They will reign forever
They shall be rewarded
They will be forgotten
questions.correctAnswer: They shall be destroyed forever
questions.explanation: Psalms 92:7 prophesies that though the wicked flourish like grass, they will be destroyed forever. This doctrine of ultimate judgment is echoed in Psalm 1:4-6, Isaiah 40:7-8, Matthew 7:19, and 2 Thessalonians 1:9.

questions.question: How does Psalms 92:8 describe the LORD in contrast to the wicked?
options: The LORD is most high forevermore
The LORD is temporary and fleeting
The LORD is hidden and unknowable
The LORD is weak and powerless
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD is most high forevermore
questions.explanation: Psalms 92:8 contrasts the temporal flourishing of the wicked with the eternal exaltation of the LORD, who is most high forevermore. This eternal sovereignty is affirmed in Psalm 113:5-6, Daniel 4:34-35, Isaiah 6:1, and Revelation 4:8.

questions.question: What is promised to the psalmist in Psalms 92:10 using the imagery of the horn?
options: The horn will be exalted like the horn of an unicorn
The horn will be broken and humbled
The horn will be silent and still
The horn will be taken away
questions.correctAnswer: The horn will be exalted like the horn of an unicorn
questions.explanation: Psalms 92:10 promises the exaltation of the psalmist's horn like the horn of an unicorn, symbolizing strength and honor. This messianic and kingly imagery is found in Psalm 18:2, 1 Samuel 2:10, Luke 1:69, and Hebrews 1:3.

questions.question: According to Psalms 92:11, what will the psalmist's eyes and ears perceive regarding enemies?
options: Eyes shall see and ears shall hear the desire concerning wicked enemies
Eyes shall be blind and ears deaf to enemies
Eyes shall weep and ears shall be closed
Eyes shall ignore and ears shall reject
questions.correctAnswer: Eyes shall see and ears shall hear the desire concerning wicked enemies
questions.explanation: Psalms 92:11 says the psalmist’s eyes and ears will perceive the desire concerning enemies, showing God's vindication. This aligns with Psalm 35:24, Isaiah 59:19, Romans 12:19, and Revelation 6:10 which affirm God's justice toward enemies.

questions.question: What metaphor does Psalms 92:12 use to describe the flourishing of the righteous?
options: Like the palm tree and cedar in Lebanon
Like the wheat and barley in the field
Like the lily and rose in the garden
Like the olive and fig tree
questions.correctAnswer: Like the palm tree and cedar in Lebanon
questions.explanation: Psalms 92:12 describes the righteous flourishing like the palm tree and growing like a cedar in Lebanon, symbols of strength and longevity. Similar imagery appears in Jeremiah 17:7-8, Ezekiel 31:8-9, and Revelation 22:2 indicating prosperity and divine blessing.

questions.question: Where does Psalms 92:13 say those planted by the LORD will flourish?
options: In the house of the LORD and courts of our God
In the wilderness and desert
In the cities of men
In the fields and valleys
questions.correctAnswer: In the house of the LORD and courts of our God
questions.explanation: Psalms 92:13 states those planted in the house of the LORD will flourish in His courts, emphasizing the blessings of covenant relationship. This is consistent with Psalm 1:3, Jeremiah 17:7, John 15:5, and Ephesians 2:19 - the church as God's dwelling place.

questions.question: What does Psalms 92:14 say about the fruitfulness of the righteous in old age?
options: They shall still bring forth fruit and be flourishing
They will cease to bear fruit and wither
They shall be forgotten and ignored
They will be weak and sickly
questions.correctAnswer: They shall still bring forth fruit and be flourishing
questions.explanation: Psalms 92:14 promises the righteous will continue fruitful and flourishing even in old age, signifying God's sustaining grace. This is supported by Proverbs 4:18, Isaiah 40:31, 2 Corinthians 12:9, and John 15:8.

questions.question: How does Psalms 92:15 describe the character of the LORD?
options: Upright, a rock with no unrighteousness
Deceptive, shifting like sand
Weak, easily overcome
Indifferent and distant
questions.correctAnswer: Upright, a rock with no unrighteousness
questions.explanation: Psalms 92:15 declares the LORD is upright, a rock, and without unrighteousness, underscoring His perfect justice and faithfulness. This attribute is affirmed in Deuteronomy 32:4, Isaiah 25:1, 1 Corinthians 10:4, and James 1:17.

questions.question: What theme does Psalms 92 present regarding the fate of the wicked and the righteous?
options: Wicked will perish; righteous will flourish
Wicked will flourish; righteous will perish
Both wicked and righteous will perish
Both wicked and righteous will flourish equally
questions.correctAnswer: Wicked will perish; righteous will flourish
questions.explanation: The psalm contrasts the ultimate destruction of the wicked (vv.7,9) with the flourishing of the righteous (vv.12-14), teaching divine justice and blessing. This theme is found in Psalm 1:6, Proverbs 11:31, Matthew 13:40-42, and Revelation 21:8.
